displayName.text: Umaid Bhawan-A Royal Heritage Style Boutique Hotel

places.shortFormattedAddress: D1-2A, Via Bank Road, Collectorate, Meera Marg, Bani Park, Jaipur

editorialSummary.text: Quaint quarters in a refined heritage hotel offering a sophisticated restaurant & an outdoor pool.

text.text:
One of the worst hotel experiences I’ve ever had. The staff has a very bad attitude – they don’t help with anything and simply say “no” to every request. There is no valet service, and the hotel is located in a very bad spot inside narrow streets. The room was poorly maintained with broken switches, dirty bedsheets, and overall unhygienic conditions. Breakfast was terrible, and staff made no effort to provide anything properly.

Parking is a nightmare – there is no proper parking space, and I had to keep moving my car around looking for space multiple times.

Overall, extremely unprofessional and careless staff with the worst service. Definitely not recommended at all.

text.text: Rooms lack air circulation. Feel a bit clustry. However, the decor and design is mesmerizingly beautiful. Lifts were a bit smelly. Hope that is only due to monsoon humidity. Pool is very relaxing and the service is professionally well.

text.text:
We had booked online at Umaid Bhawan. We got free pick-up facility. But as soon as we reached, we had to carry our luggage ourselves to the reception because there was no bell boy available to help. We checked in a room but the curtains there were torn, so they shifted us to another room. As soon as we entered the another room, the room was so small that even our luggage bag could not be opened. The balcony was also very small. When we complained at the reception that these were not the category of rooms that we had booked, the receptionist said that this is heritage property and all the rooms here are same. The pictures on the internet are just for reference. We were very surprised but they ignored us. The tea bags provided in the rooms were also open and not in proper packaging, which is below standard for a heritage property. When we tried to turn on the TV, we found out that the set top box was faulty. The housekeeping staff tried to fix the TV for half an hour but finally said sorry and left. Then our wifi was also not working so we complained to the reception twice but still we did not get any help. Our booking was for 2 days but we immediately cancelled our bookings for the next day and booked in another hotel. Because there is no point in staying where guests' comfort is not taken care of. Decor and food was good. Otherwise service needs improvement.
So our stay at Umaid Bhawan Royal Style Heritage Boutique Hotel was nothing special.

text.text:
Bhanwar singh was an awesome steward at the hotel and he was very helpful and attentive and caring for our needs.
Overall we loved our stay at Umaid! Perfect location, and the staff were so amazing. Would recommend anyone to stay here.

text.text:
The front desk staff, Bharat, was friendly, warm, and helpful. When we checked in, there was a small problem with the room we had booked, so he couldn’t give us that exact one. But he handled it quickly, helped us as much as he could, and gave us another room that was very comfortable — even better than we expected.

This hotel is very unique — it was the most memorable one on our whole trip. It was started in 1993 by a former royal family from Borunda. The whole place has a royal Rajasthani style, like an old palace, with carved balconies and a rooftop restaurant. Staying here felt like traveling back in time… almost like being royalty!

The hotel breakfast was also great, with many tasty options. The staff were very kind and welcoming. If you ever visit Jaipur, you should definitely stay here for a night—or even a few nights. You won’t regret it :)

text.text: This review is based on our recent 3 night stay at the hotel. Overall ambiance of the room was good. However, there was lack of basic hospitality in terms of drinking bislery water, basic toiletries, lack of hooks & hangers, limited ventilation and absence of complimentary services with strict rules for each and every thing. Not worthy for a premium room rent of more than 3k per night.

text.text:
I booked this place expecting a *luxury boutique hotel* experience, but unfortunately, it was anything but that. The property felt shady from the moment I entered. The rooms were poorly maintained, with a constant unpleasant smell that made the stay very uncomfortable. Cleanliness and hygiene were a big concern; the bathrooms and linens did not feel properly cleaned, which is unacceptable for any hotel, let alone one that markets itself as “luxury.”

What made things worse was the staff. Instead of being courteous and helpful, they were uncooperative and dismissive of even basic requests. Hospitality was completely missing, which is surprising in a city like Jaipur that is otherwise known for its warmth and service.

Overall, this hotel is *far from* what it claims to be. If you’re looking for comfort, hygiene, and good service, I’d strongly recommend looking at other options in Jaipur. This place was a huge disappointment and not worth the money.

text.text: We stayed at Sarang Palace for 4 nights. The rooms and washrooms were a bit smaller than what we expected from the photos, but the place was clean and well kept. The food here was honestly a highlight whatever we tried, whether breakfast, lunch or dinner, everything tasted really good and felt worth the price. The hotel is also close to the main tourist spots, and getting a tuk-tuk right outside was super easy. Overall, it was a good stay and I’d happily recommend it.

editorialSummary.text: Luxe rooms & suites, plus a serene spa, a fine dining restaurant & free breakfast.

text.text:
Shahpura House Hotel is a beautiful property with a traditional charm that truly stands out. The rooms are neat, spacious, and well-maintained, making our stay very comfortable. The rooftop restaurant is lovely and adds to the overall experience.

However, a few areas need improvement. The breakfast buffet was average, and the baked items such as croissants and donuts were below par. Our experience with the spa was also disappointing. Despite receiving a call from the spa, there was no male masseuse available in the evening. When we tried to book a session for my wife the following morning, we were told that no female masseuse would be available during those hours either, which was quite frustrating.

The valet service also requires attention. The staff often appeared disengaged instead of being attentive to guests.

On a positive note, the reception team was excellent — professional, courteous, and always ready help.

However, with a five star hotel status, we expected more from Shahpura House. Hence the 4 stars.

We would love to come back next time with our children.

text.text:
I stayed at this property expecting a palace experience, but unfortunately, the service fell far below expectations.

We handed over the room keys at 12 noon requesting the room to be cleaned, only to return at 1 AM and find it in exactly the same condition—nothing was cleaned, toiletries were not replenished, and the room was left untouched despite clear instructions. This was extremely disappointing, especially considering the standard the property claims to uphold.

Even for small requests like cold drinking water, the response is painfully slow. Simple things that should have taken a few minutes stretched endlessly, making our stay frustrating.

The staff is humble and polite, and I appreciate that, but hospitality is not just about good manners; it’s about fulfilling basic guest needs promptly and efficiently, which this property failed to do repeatedly during our stay.

Overall, the place is beautiful, but the management seriously needs to improve their operational efficiency if they wish to provide a true palace experience to their guests.

editorialSummary.text: Warm artisan-inspired rooms in an unassuming hotel offering a garden terrace & Wi-Fi.

text.text:
A peaceful and beautiful stay at Jaipur bungalow!
I had a wonderful experience and Jaipur bungalow. It’s a cozy, comfortable place located in quiet residential area. The house has a beautiful traditional concept with elegant blue pottery, decor, and refreshing white and blue colour theme that gives it a calming vibe.
The property is spread over three floors and has been smarty converted into a Boutique style Hotel. I truly enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing stay in Jaipur. I would love to come back again just to unwind.
They also offered Jacuzzi and spa facilities, which I didn’t get to try this time but definitely something to look forward to on my next visit.

text.text:
Experience can’t be more worse than the stay. Booked the hotel for 2 nights. We checked in late around 9pm, they must have ample amount of time to make sure the room is clean and ready.
1. Spider web on the washroom wall.
2. Curtains along with curtain rod fall on me as soon as I touched the curtain to check what’s behind.
3. Any guesses what’s behind? An open window - very dirty outside of that area. Washroom exhaust open area, very pungent smell.
4. Zero in hospitality.
5. Urine spots and hair on toilet seat.

When we asked at the reception- reason for the leftover spider web - he is like “Reh gaya hoga na”
When asked him to fix the curtain - he is like “ye kaise gira dia aapne” we were like hamne gira dia..! Wtf.
When asked why the window was open - answer was - “aapne he kholi hogi”

When asked why the area outside window isn’t clean - answer- “wo to bahr hai na sir”

When asked about unclean toilet seat - response - “sir saaf he to hai or abhi staff nahi hai sbha saaf kr denge”.

My suggestion: Better stay on the footpath compared to staying here in this hotel.

He wasn’t Sorry at all too.

text.text:
Horrible Experience – Rude Staff, Unsafe for Kids, and Aggressive Behavior

This was by far the worst hotel experience I’ve ever had. If you’re traveling with family, especially with kids – stay away from this place.

We were just 25 minutes late for checkout, and charged us 1500₹ extra for that half an hour. We politely explained that we had a young child with us. Instead of showing any understanding or basic decency, the management started shouting at us. It was completely uncalled for and extremely unprofessional.

When we started recording the situation (which we had every right to do), the staff tried to snatch our phones — an outrageous and aggressive act. Is this how guests are treated here?

Overall, the staff is rude, the management is money-minded and aggressive, and there is no sense of hospitality or customer respect. Charging ₹1500 for a 25-minute delay with a child, shouting at guests, and attempting to take their phones — that says everything about how this hotel is run.

Highly unsafe and unprofessional – would never return and strongly advise others to avoid.

text.text:
My experience at Hilton Jaipur was absolutely delightful. Right from the time I walked in, I was treated with courtesy and professionalism. The lobby is so elegant and friendly looking, it immediately relaxes you.

The rooms were well-spacious, neat, and tidy, and all the minute details were well taken care of. The housekeeping staff did a great job in providing comfort and hygiene.

What truly impressed me was the hospitality of the staff. Every encounter whether it was from the front desk staff to restaurant service was friendly, attentive, and made me feel truly cared for. They were always willing to assist with a smile.

The cuisine was also a highlight. The spread during the buffet featured a range of dishes, both international and local, and every meal was fresh and delicious. Watching the sunset view from the rooftop in the evening is not to be missed , it provides an added special touch to the experience.

Overall, Hilton Jaipur provides the ideal combination of luxury, comfort, and hospitality. It's not so much a hotel, but a home away from home. I would highly recommend it to any visitor to Jaipur, business or pleasure.

We recently enjoyed a two night stay at the Jaipur Hilton. Great room, extremely comfortable beds and friendly, helpful staff. We enjoyable the buffet restaurant for both breakfast and dinner and thought it had an excellent wide selection of dishes. The staff were also very helpful in showing us how to combine the different Indian dishes.
We also used the rooftop bar and swimming pool due to the hot steamy weather. A really lovely place to stay.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying a night at Hilton Resort Jaipur, and it was truly a delightful experience. The property beautifully blends modern comfort with Rajasthani elegance, offering a perfect getaway within the city. The check-in process was smooth, and the staff was extremely courteous, always ready to assist with a warm smile.
The room was spacious, well-maintained, and offered a great view, making the stay very comfortable. The resort amenities, including the pool and spa, added to the relaxation. Dinner at the restaurant was exceptional, with a wide variety of dishes and authentic flavors. The breakfast spread was equally impressive, offering both Indian and continental options.
What stood out the most was the hospitality – every staff member made sure the stay felt special. Even though it was just for a night, the experience was memorable and refreshing.
Highly recommend Hilton Resort Jaipur for anyone looking for a luxurious and peaceful stay in the Pink City.

The ambiance, interiors, and overall vibe reflect the rich cultural history, making it feel like a stay in a palace.

The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-maintained. The staff was courteous and helpful throughout our stay. Every corner of the hotel has a story to tell — perfect for anyone who loves heritage and history.

The experience was peaceful, comfortable, and full of character. Highly recommended for families, couples, or anyone wanting a royal Rajasthani stay!

text.text:
*Disappointing Experience at Sawai Man Mahal, Jaipur*

Rating: 1/5

I recently had the misfortune of staying at the Sawai Man Mahal in Jaipur, a hotel that boasts of being a 5-star property. Unfortunately, the staff's behavior and service were far from what one would expect from a luxury hotel.

From the moment we arrived, the staff seemed completely disinterested in greeting us or helping us with our luggage.
Person who assisted us was Devender and Ashutosh. The check-in process was slow and cumbersome, and the staff seemed put off by our presence.

Throughout our stay, we encountered numerous instances of rude and unhelpful behavior from the staff. They seemed more interested in chatting with each other than attending to our needs or addressing our concerns (Rajveer in Breakfast Area)

The lack of enthusiasm and warmth from the staff made our stay feel unwelcome and unenjoyable. For a hotel that claims to be a 5-star property, the service was shockingly subpar.

Unless the management takes serious steps to address these issues and train their staff to provide better service, I would not recommend Sawai Man Mahal to anyone.

*Room Tip:* Avoid this hotel until they improve their staff's behavior and service.

*Traveler Type:* Couple

*Disappointing Experience at Sawai Man Mahal, Jaipur*

Rating: 1/5

I recently had the misfortune of staying at the Sawai Man Mahal in Jaipur, a hotel that boasts of being a 5-star property. Unfortunately, the staff's behavior and service were far from what one would expect from a luxury hotel.

From the moment we arrived, the staff seemed completely disinterested in greeting us or helping us with our luggage.
Person who assisted us was Devender and Ashutosh. The check-in process was slow and cumbersome, and the staff seemed put off by our presence.

Throughout our stay, we encountered numerous instances of rude and unhelpful behavior from the staff. They seemed more interested in chatting with each other than attending to our needs or addressing our concerns (Rajveer in Breakfast Area)

The lack of enthusiasm and warmth from the staff made our stay feel unwelcome and unenjoyable. For a hotel that claims to be a 5-star property, the service was shockingly subpar.

Unless the management takes serious steps to address these issues and train their staff to provide better service, I would not recommend Sawai Man Mahal to anyone.

*Room Tip:* Avoid this hotel until they improve their staff's behavior and service.

*Traveler Type:* Couple

text.text:
Sawai Man Mahal is one of Jaipur’s most elegant heritage palaces, reflecting the grandeur and royal lifestyle of the Rajput kings. Built by Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II in the early 20th century, the palace was originally part of the City Palace complex and served as the royal residence. Today, it stands as a fine example of Jaipur’s regal legacy, seamlessly blending Rajput architectural traditions with subtle European influences.

The palace boasts spacious courtyards, intricately designed archways, and beautifully decorated interiors that reflect the refinement of Jaipur’s royal era. Its grand halls and galleries, adorned with traditional motifs and artworks, evoke the splendor of a time when Jaipur was a flourishing cultural and political center. Over the years, Sawai Man Mahal has hosted royal gatherings, state functions, and important visitors, carrying forward its legacy of hospitality and grace.

What makes Sawai Man Mahal truly special is its ability to transport visitors into a world of timeless beauty. Standing within its walls, one can feel the echoes of royal footsteps, the elegance of tradition, and the charm of an era that continues to define Jaipur’s identity. It remains a proud symbol of Rajasthan’s heritage and magnificence.

text.text:
Pros:  location is perfect for sightseeing and shopping in Jaipur.  Their in house tour concierge was helpful in arranging a very good 8 hour car/driver to see the sights of Jaipur.  The breakfast was included and was pretty good; we ate there each day.  They have a bar available, although it doesn’t seem too busy.  They have room service and the food was good. The external appearance and lobby area are nice, and the doorman/reception staff and restaurant/bar staff were all attentive, and polite, providing excellent service.

Issues:  The staff doing the room cleaning needed to be reminded to clean the rooms (recommend being very clear) and did a rather rapid/not thorough room cleaning, with variable restocking of items.  When room service trays were left in the hall, they were left all night; the night staff should do rounds and clear the halls of such items, not leaving to the daytime cleaning crew which seemed to arrive around 11 am or noon or so.  Used the laundry service, which was slower than others used in India (took almost 48 hours).

Overall an inexpensive option in a great location, but would not recommend for a multi day stay.

text.text:
I stayed at Hotel Indo Prime on MI Road, Jaipur for 2 nights and had a really pleasant experience , especially at the price point I booked it for.
The cleanliness of the hotel was excellent, and the staff was polite, responsive, and professional throughout my stay. From the front desk to the housekeeping and breakfast staff, everyone made sure I was comfortable.
All the basic amenities you'd expect from a good hotel were well in place, comfortable rooms, clean bathrooms, good Wi-Fi, and a decent breakfast spread.
On the first day, there was a bit of disturbance due to their regular elevation mirror cleaning, but I mentioned it at the reception and they promptly took care of it, ensuring it didn’t affect the rest of my stay. Really appreciated their responsiveness!
Overall, I’d definitely recommend Hotel Indo Prime to anyone visiting Jaipur and looking for a well-managed, value-for-money stay in a central location. Will surely consider staying again.

text.text:
Disappointing Experience at Chirmi Palace Café, Jaipur

I recently visited Chirmi Palace Café, Jaipur with high expectations, but unfortunately, my experience was quite disappointing. Right from the beginning, the service failed to meet even basic hospitality standards.

I had ordered a cold coffee, which was shockingly served in a broken glass. When I pointed this out to the staff, instead of preparing a fresh one or even straining it, they simply poured the same drink into another glass, which is not only unprofessional but also unhygienic. Such negligence in service is unacceptable, especially when you’re charging premium prices from guests.

We also ordered pasta, which turned out to be excessively sweet, making it far from enjoyable. The taste and quality of the food were truly disappointing — far below what one would expect from a café in this price range.

The only redeeming aspect of the café was its quiet and pleasant ambience, but that alone cannot make up for poor food quality and lackluster service. Overall, it was a horrible experience, and I sincerely hope the management takes guest feedback seriously and works on improving both hospitality and food standards.

Not recommended until major improvements are made.

text.text:
This hotel is a total scam. They advertise three categories of rooms using misleading photos, but in reality, all the pictures are of just one decent room on the ground floor. Upon arrival, they demand additional cash beyond the original booking amount in order to "upgrade" to a usable room. The rest of the rooms are in a pathetic, unlivable condition — not even worthy of a 1-star rating.

The situation was so bad that I didn’t even check into the room. To make matters worse, they have a strict no-cancellation, no-refund policy. I lost my entire payment for a 3-night stay and had to book another hotel last minute, spending significantly more.

This place seems to have shady practices running behind the scenes. Avoid at all costs!

text.text:
We had the pleasure of staying in the ‘Indus’ studio.

The studio itself is very comfortable, attractive and quiet.  The bed and and bed linen in particular is luxurious.  Space is used well and the decorations add warmth and atmosphere.  We have found the staff in particular, to be warm, friendly and very helpful.  They were always ready to assist with anything we needed and when we had problems, they worked hard to overcome them and find solutions.  We are very sorry to leave here and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.

Many thanks to you all for making our stay in Jaipur a memorable and pleasurable one.

text.text:
The good: The rooms had a lot of character and the suite that we booked was really big. The building was really interesting and beautifully tiled. The bathroom was also spacious and amenities good. Staff on reception were friendly and helpful. Filtered water (sustainable) and operational fridge - needed in hot Jaipur!

To improve: the breakfast arrangements as others mentioned were chaotic. We tried to book a 7:45am breakfast but were told too many had booked, so offered 8:15. All good - but then we eventually waited 1 hour for breakfast until 9:15 without water or tea/ coffee. I get that the breakfast is made in the other building but there needs to be a better system.

The linen in the room was also quite old. The bed sheets had a hole in it. I guess it’s a b&b, but expected slightly better.

Staff on reception were friendly and helpful. Filtered water (sustainable) and operational fridge - needed in hot Jaipur!

To improve: the breakfast arrangements as others mentioned were chaotic. We tried to book a 7:45am breakfast but were told too many had booked, so offered 8:15. All good - but then we eventually waited 1 hour for breakfast until 9:15 without water or tea/ coffee. I get that the breakfast is made in the other building but there needs to be a better system.

The linen in the room was also quite old. The bed sheets had a hole in it. I guess it’s a b&b, but expected slightly better.

editorialSummary.text: Sophisticated rooms in an elegant hotel with a restaurant, a 24-hour coffee shop & a rooftop pool.

text.text:
We stayed in two rooms for two nights. The hotel has a clean, welcoming lobby and courteous reception staff, which made for a good first impression.
However, the housekeeping was a major letdown. While the rooms were clean on arrival, no bathroom towels were provided on either day in both rooms. The towels we eventually received were old and in need of replacement. On the second day, beds were made, but the floors and toilets were not cleaned at all — very disappointing.
Breakfast was equally underwhelming. The food was lukewarm, the variety minimal, and overall cleanliness in the dining area was poor. On the second morning, there were no chefs present at 7:45 AM to make omelettes, despite that being a listed service.
The hotel’s location on main Tonk Road is definitely a plus, but significant improvements in cleanliness, towel quality, and breakfast service are needed to deliver a truly comfortable stay.

editorialSummary.text: Unfussy rooms in a relaxed budget hotel offering dining & a bar, plus free Wi-Fi & breakfast.

text.text:
I recently had a disappointing experience at Hotel Wall Street Beacon, jaipur . While the service was good, there were a few issues that left a bad taste. Firstly, despite being promised a 15% discount on food and beverages during booking, I was charged full amount without any discount. The staff asked me to avail it on my next visit.

Furthermore, I was surprised to find 4 snack packets and 2 drink cans in my room without any prior information or menu. When I checked out, I was charged heavily for these items - ₹555 for 4 small snack packets, 2 water bottles, and 2 cans (Coca Cola and Sprite). There was no indication that these items would be chargeable.

Additionally, the hotel had advertised complimentary drinks on arrival, but I didn't receive any. I felt that the hotel's way of charging without prior information was unfair. Hotels can charge for amenities, but transparency is key. Guests should be informed about chargeable items beforehand.

text.text:
People say this hotel offers clean rooms and delicious food. They also highlight the central location, friendly staff, and great hospitality.

Some reviews mention the food can be overpriced.

Let me be honest to begin with, Umaid Bhavan was the last place we looked at when we were searching for stays in Jaipur. Having looked at some of the other heritage style resorts, which seemed pretty good, but since reviews mentioned rooms/property were not in line with what they had seen in pics, we explored a bit more and came across this place in the last moment. Looking at the pics and reviews, we somehow liked this better than the others so decided to book this off. Really glad we did!

The whole property is beautiful, with a nice royal heritage touch throughout. On the day of check in, they were courteous enough to let's check in a couple of hrs early, felt good since we wanted to rest a bit before getting on with our touristy activities :)

When we entered the royal suite that we had reserved, we were pleasantly surprised with the neatness of the room and the beautiful heritage look it had throughout!And it was huugeeee! Probably the biggest room we have stayed in so far!  The bed, the sofa, chairs, ceiling, the sit out area adjacent to windows with a view of the swimming pool, everything accentuated the look and feel of the room.

Coming to common areas in the property, each floor has been given a beautiful heritage look, including the stairs where they have thoughtfully kept accessories to accentuate the look. We loved spending a bit of time at different spots taking pics 😃 A big shoutout to the management and staff here for their attention to keeping the property and rooms so neat and clean!

Though initially we had planned to eat only once in their in house restaurant and eat out rest of the times, we ended up eating all our meals here except for the lunch on 2nd day when we were out visiting forts! Dining area on terrace has a simple yet beautiful look and feel. What drew us to it subsequently was the tasty lunch we had here, we didn't need to worry about where to eat next! They provided good service throughout, so that's a plus point. At night, they have a group playing local traditional songs accompanied by some dance performances, which was good to witness while we enjoyed our drinks and ate away yummy food :)

I can say, without a doubt, that everything we experienced here in person was much better than what we had seen in pics!

The only drawback we experienced was, their buffet breakfast was not up to mark, especially the south indian items. But that was a minor thing for us considering how great everything else was!

Would highly recommend for people wanting to stay in a heritage style property in Jaipur at a reasonable cost. This being located centrally, visiting market or other touristy spots was easier too.

originalText.text:
Let me be honest to begin with, Umaid Bhavan was the last place we looked at when we were searching for stays in Jaipur. Having looked at some of the other heritage style resorts, which seemed pretty good, but since reviews mentioned rooms/property were not in line with what they had seen in pics, we explored a bit more and came across this place in the last moment. Looking at the pics and reviews, we somehow liked this better than the others so decided to book this off. Really glad we did!

The whole property is beautiful, with a nice royal heritage touch throughout. On the day of check in, they were courteous enough to let's check in a couple of hrs early, felt good since we wanted to rest a bit before getting on with our touristy activities :)

When we entered the royal suite that we had reserved, we were pleasantly surprised with the neatness of the room and the beautiful heritage look it had throughout!And it was huugeeee! Probably the biggest room we have stayed in so far!  The bed, the sofa, chairs, ceiling, the sit out area adjacent to windows with a view of the swimming pool, everything accentuated the look and feel of the room.

Coming to common areas in the property, each floor has been given a beautiful heritage look, including the stairs where they have thoughtfully kept accessories to accentuate the look. We loved spending a bit of time at different spots taking pics 😃 A big shoutout to the management and staff here for their attention to keeping the property and rooms so neat and clean!

Though initially we had planned to eat only once in their in house restaurant and eat out rest of the times, we ended up eating all our meals here except for the lunch on 2nd day when we were out visiting forts! Dining area on terrace has a simple yet beautiful look and feel. What drew us to it subsequently was the tasty lunch we had here, we didn't need to worry about where to eat next! They provided good service throughout, so that's a plus point. At night, they have a group playing local traditional songs accompanied by some dance performances, which was good to witness while we enjoyed our drinks and ate away yummy food :)

I can say, without a doubt, that everything we experienced here in person was much better than what we had seen in pics!

The only drawback we experienced was, their buffet breakfast was not up to mark, especially the south indian items. But that was a minor thing for us considering how great everything else was!

Would highly recommend for people wanting to stay in a heritage style property in Jaipur at a reasonable cost. This being located centrally, visiting market or other touristy spots was easier too.

text.text:
It's a nice cosy boutique hotel.
Feels like you have travelled back in time, with a physical register for check-in, actual keys with metal key chain as opposed to the chip enabled cards.
Rooms are comfortable and the artwork on the ceiling and walls are good
The service is fine considering the time period in which you get transported.
Breakfast is a buffet self service one which is not that out of place, though you may not have waiters asking you to serve tea or anything else, you need something you get up from your chair and get it.
There is good WiFi connection.
Worth every penny considering that we got a good deal in October 2021.

text.text: Shahpura House in Banipark is a stunning gem, where every corner is filled with intricate art and detailing. The property is truly magnificent, offering beautiful rooms, a serene pool, and exquisite dining spaces. While the food is just average, the overall experience of staying here makes you feel like royalty in Jaipur. With traditional Rajasthani puppet shows and Kalbelia dance performances for in-house guests, the hotel adds a cultural touch. From the moment you arrive, you're welcomed with the warmth and charm of a traditional Rajasthani greeting, making it a must-visit for a regal experience in Jaipur.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of celebrating my husband's birthday at the Taj Hari Mahal in Jodhpur, and it was an unforgettable experience thanks to the wonderful staff. From the moment we arrived, Divya at the front desk greeted us with warm hospitality and a beautiful traditional welcome. Lokendra, the manager, went above and beyond by upgrading our room and making arrangements for a lovely bouquet, which was a pleasant surprise.

The hotel itself is stunning, with intricate architecture and luxurious amenities. Narendra from Housekeeping did an excellent job decorating our room, which added a personal touch to our stay. The staff, including Bishan, Brinda, and Subodh, were attentive to our every need, making sure that we had everything we needed to make our stay as comfortable as possible. One thing that really stood out was that they served water in glass bottles, which we really appreciated as it shows their commitment towards sustainability.

The highlight of our stay was definitely the birthday celebration for my husband. The hotel staff went above and beyond to make it a special occasion. They decorated our room with balloons and flowers, and surprised my husband with a delicious birthday cake cut with Talwar. We also enjoyed a romantic dinner at the hotel's restaurant, where the food was delicious and the service was impeccable, thanks to Bishan, Brinda, Ravindra and Subodh & special thanks to Anand who arranged cake in very short time.

In true spirit, the staff at Taj Hari Mahal follow the saying 'अतिथि देवो भवः' (Atithi Devo Bhava) which means 'Guest is God.' Their commitment to hospitality and excellent service made our stay at Taj Hari Mahal a truly unforgettable experience!!!!

I recently had the pleasure of staying at ibis Jaipur Civil Lines, and I must say it was an amazing experience from start to finish! The staff at this hotel is incredibly lovely and made my stay truly memorable.

Right from the moment I walked through the doors, I was greeted with warm smiles and a genuine eagerness to assist. The staff members were attentive, professional, and always ready to go the extra mile to ensure my comfort.

Whether it was answering my questions, providing recommendations, or addressing any concerns, they were knowledgeable and helpful throughout my stay.

The hotel itself was well-maintained, clean, and had a modern aesthetic. My room was spacious, comfortable, and equipped with all the amenities I needed for a pleasant stay. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job of keeping everything tidy and refreshed.

The location of ibis Jaipur Civil Lines was also convenient, with easy access to nearby attractions and transportation options. I appreciated the hotel's proximity to popular landmarks, as it made exploring the city hassle-free.

During my stay, I had the opportunity to dine at the hotel's restaurant, and I must say, the food was delicious. The breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of options to suit different tastes, and the quality was top-notch. The staff in the restaurant were attentive and ensured that I had a great dining experience.

Overall, my experience at ibis Jaipur Civil Lines exceeded my expectations. The combination of the amazing staff, lovely ambiance, and exceptional service made my stay truly memorable. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Jaipur.

A special mention goes to Shourya Thank you for making my stay so enjoyable!

text.text:
All-Time Favourite Stay in Jaipur!

Ibis Jaipur has always been my top choice whenever I visit the city. The hotel offers a consistently pleasant experience—thanks to the courteous and attentive staff who make every stay memorable. The Spice It restaurant never disappoints with its wide variety of cuisines and consistently delicious food.

The rooms are always well-prepared with all the basic amenities in place. Housekeeping staff are prompt and efficient, always ready to clean and set the room just right. Another big plus is their early morning breakfast service, starting at 6:30 am—perfect for early risers or business travelers.

A special thanks to Tanbir from the F&B department. He’s truly a gem—always welcoming guests with a smile and a positive attitude. Polite, helpful, and professional, Tanbir made every dining experience at Spice It feel warm and personal. I heard today is your last day at Ibis—wishing you all the best in your future endeavors!

I also want to highlight the reception staff, who have always been incredibly professional and accommodating. text.text:
The Sawai Man Mahal in Jaipur is not just a stunning palace-turned-hotel with lush gardens, but it also offers an exceptional experience thanks to its incredible staff. The service provided by the entire team, especially Rahul, Taranjit, and the rest of the staff, is truly commendable.

During our anniversary celebration at the hotel, we were blown away by the surprises and special touches arranged by the staff. Upon entering our room, we were greeted with a beautifully decorated space, complete with romantic elements that made our anniversary even more memorable. The thoughtfulness didn't end there; we were also treated to a delicious cake as part of the celebration.

The staff's attention to detail and care extended to our toddler as well. Much to our delight, our little one received an adorable teddy bear as a gift from the hotel. This small gesture showcased the staff's genuine warmth and consideration for all guests, regardless of age.

The dining experience at the Sawai Man Mahal was equally impressive. The dinner we enjoyed was simply awesome, with a wide array of delectable dishes and impeccable service from the restaurant staff. The staff at Amber, the hotel's restaurant, were particularly helpful in guiding us through the menu options and ensuring we had a fantastic culinary experience.

Throughout our stay, we were consistently impressed by the staff's friendliness, humility, and grace in service. From the reception to the housekeeping team, everyone went above and beyond to make our anniversary celebration truly special and unforgettable.

In conclusion, the Sawai Man Mahal in Jaipur offers an unparalleled experience, thanks to its stunning setting, excellent amenities, and most importantly, its exceptional staff. Rahul, Taranjit, and the entire team's dedication to providing top-notch service, combined with their thoughtful surprises and attention to detail, made our anniversary celebration an enchanting and memorable affair. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a royal and unforgettable experience in the heart of Jaipur.

text.text:
Pros:  location is perfect for sightseeing and shopping in Jaipur.  Their in house tour concierge was helpful in arranging a very good 8 hour car/driver to see the sights of Jaipur.  The breakfast was included and was pretty good; we ate there each day.  They have a bar available, although it doesn’t seem too busy.  They have room service and the food was good. The external appearance and lobby area are nice, and the doorman/reception staff and restaurant/bar staff were all attentive, and polite, providing excellent service.

Issues:  The staff doing the room cleaning needed to be reminded to clean the rooms (recommend being very clear) and did a rather rapid/not thorough room cleaning, with variable restocking of items.  When room service trays were left in the hall, they were left all night; the night staff should do rounds and clear the halls of such items, not leaving to the daytime cleaning crew which seemed to arrive around 11 am or noon or so.  Used the laundry service, which was slower than others used in India (took almost 48 hours).

Overall an inexpensive option in a great location, but would not recommend for a multi day stay.

text.text:
I stayed at Hotel Indo Prime on MI Road, Jaipur for 2 nights and had a really pleasant experience , especially at the price point I booked it for.
The cleanliness of the hotel was excellent, and the staff was polite, responsive, and professional throughout my stay. From the front desk to the housekeeping and breakfast staff, everyone made sure I was comfortable.
All the basic amenities you'd expect from a good hotel were well in place, comfortable rooms, clean bathrooms, good Wi-Fi, and a decent breakfast spread.
On the first day, there was a bit of disturbance due to their regular elevation mirror cleaning, but I mentioned it at the reception and they promptly took care of it, ensuring it didn’t affect the rest of my stay. Really appreciated their responsiveness!
Overall, I’d definitely recommend Hotel Indo Prime to anyone visiting Jaipur and looking for a well-managed, value-for-money stay in a central location. Will surely consider staying again.

text.text:
We had one of the best hotel stays. The hotel entrance, seating area, and room design and decor were marvelous. The washroom was neat, clean, and very spacious. We stayed in a deluxe room, which had one king bed and one sofa bed, and the room itself was also very spacious and clean.

The restaurant's decor, along with the evening Rajasthani dance and puppet show, was truly mesmerizing. The food was delicious and more affordable compared to Delhi and Agra. The breakfast was excellent, and the service was outstanding. The staff here are very kind and patient.

I highly recommend this Mahal to anyone planning a trip to Jaipur.

text.text:
We stayed in two rooms for two nights. The hotel has a clean, welcoming lobby and courteous reception staff, which made for a good first impression.
However, the housekeeping was a major letdown. While the rooms were clean on arrival, no bathroom towels were provided on either day in both rooms. The towels we eventually received were old and in need of replacement. On the second day, beds were made, but the floors and toilets were not cleaned at all — very disappointing.
Breakfast was equally underwhelming. The food was lukewarm, the variety minimal, and overall cleanliness in the dining area was poor. On the second morning, there were no chefs present at 7:45 AM to make omelettes, despite that being a listed service.
The hotel’s location on main Tonk Road is definitely a plus, but significant improvements in cleanliness, towel quality, and breakfast service are needed to deliver a truly comfortable stay.

text.text: We had a wonderful stay here over Christmas during our Indian travels (we are from Sweden). Very spacious and clean rooms, very large windows with a nice view, lots of green, a beautiful terrace where we could relax, generous breakfast spread, and we also had a lavish dinner buffet for Christmas. Great room service. Very helpful and pleasant staff. Excellent location, close to everything but in a side street that's more quiet. Great value for money. Absolutely recommend.
